Key Match Events: Greece scored their first goal early in the second half through Tasos Bakasetas.
Caoimhín Kelleher made several key saves throughout the match.
Greece's Mantalos scored a late goal due to a mistake by Kelleher.
Ireland's Robbie Brady and Josh Cullen received yellow cards.
Ireland made several substitutions including Festy Ebosele for Chiedozie Ogbene and Jack Taylor for Evan Ferguson.
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland's recent history against Greece has been poor, with Greece winning the last four encounters.
Ireland's manager Heimir Hallgrímsson emphasized a cautious approach due to past performances in Athens.
Both teams were coming off away wins earlier in the week, with Ireland beating Finland and Greece beating England.
Post-Match Reflections: Republic of Ireland manager Heimir Hallgrímsson commented on the team's improvement in the second half and their need to perform better.
Ireland midfielder Josh Cullen reflected on the team's performance, noting their better control in the second half but disappointment in conceding early in the second half.
Cullen also mentioned the need to address the trend of conceding goals early in the second half.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win restored Greece's three-point lead at the top of the League B Group 2 table.
Ireland remains in third place in the group, above Finland.
The match was played in tribute to Greece defender George Baldock, who was found dead at his home in Athens.
